title: With Drones In Flight Over Syria, Questions Of Airstrikes Rise With Them
teaser: U.S. surveillance drones have begun to maintain a presence over Syria, preparing for possible airstrikes against the extremist group that calls itself the Islamic State. A mission to expand airstrikes inside Syria raises new questions, though, and critics on both sides ends of the policy spectrum are weighing in.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
